fields.description:
h3. Summary
SLA Does not recognize mapping of new status due to change of workflow.

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Set _Time to Resolution_ SLA in a JIRA Service Desk Project to _stop_ when the issue entered _To be Done_ status. 
# Changed the project workflow and mapped the staus of the issue from _Open_ to _To be Done_.

h3. Expected Behaviour 
* SLA should recognize mapping of new status due to change of workflow 

h3. Actual Behaviour
* _Time to Resolution_ will not stop even if the issue entered _To be Done_ status due to change of workflow and mapping of new status

JIRA Version: 7.0.0-OD-02-259
JIRA Service Desk Version:2.6.0-OD-11-003-D20150831T232628
fields.summary: SLA does not recognize mapping of new status due to change of workflow

fields.description:
Webhook payloads for comments made through the "JSD Respond To Customer/Internal" comment UI doesn't seem to apply standard JIRA comment visibility levels (which _do_ populate correctly in webhooks).  As a result the comment received can only be evaluated as exactly that, resulting in follow on processing that the user did not expect.

Example JSD internal notification webhook payload:
{noformat}
  "body": "Hey, does andy get this (test) -- entered via service desk internal comment mode....",
            "updateAuthor": {
              "self": "https://thepluginpeople.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/user?username=abrook",
              "name": "abrook",
              "key": "abrook",
              "emailAddress": "javahollic at gmail dot com",
              "avatarUrls": {
                "48x48": "https://thepluginpeople.atlassian.net/secure/useravatar?ownerId=abrook&avatarId=11460",
                "24x24": "https://thepluginpeople.atlassian.net/secure/useravatar?size=small&ownerId=abrook&avatarId=11460",
                "16x16": "https://thepluginpeople.atlassian.net/secure/useravatar?size=xsmall&ownerId=abrook&avatarId=11460",
                "32x32": "https://thepluginpeople.atlassian.net/secure/useravatar?size=medium&ownerId=abrook&avatarId=11460"
              },
              "displayName": "Andy Brook",
              "active": true,
              "timeZone": "Europe/Dublin"
            },
            "created": "2015-02-09T16:17:18.086+0000",
            "updated": "2015-02-09T16:17:18.086+0000"
{noformat}

I don't know how JSD implements Private/Public commenting, but its odd that comment visibility isn't used /set ?

I'd appreciate any pointers on how I can detect whether a comment is 'internal' or not?
fields.summary: JSD Internal comment webhooks don't have comment visibility set - results in unexpected leaking of internal comments

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When editing JIRA Service Desk Configuration, and adding a name in *Help Center Name* over 30 characters, it is not saved, yet no error is given.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to {{/secure/admin/ViewSystemInfo.jspa}}
# Next to *Help Center Name* enter a title over 30 characters.
# Click the checkbox to attempt to save.

h3. Expected Results
Generally when you click the checkbox, it loads a bit, and then saves.

h3. Actual Results
See the *loading* icon, and then the field remains editable for user to attempt with a different name. No error is thrown.

From Network tab on Chrome:
{noformat}
Remote Address:104.192.140.97:443
Request URL:[URL]/rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk-data/global-portal-settings
Request Method:PUT
Status Code:400 Bad Request{noformat}

h3.Notes
[Branding your Customer Portal|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/Branding+your+Customer+Portal] mentions usage of the field, but does not say there is any restriction on the length.
 
h3.Solution / Workaround
Choose a title under 30 characters
fields.summary: No error when reaching character limit in Help Center Name field

h3. Summary

When submitting a new request in Service Desk as a Customer with Browse User Global Permission, the Service Desk Customers is unable to use the User Picker

h3. Environment

Cloud JIRA v7.2.0-OD-05-030
JIRA Service Desk v3.2.0-OD-09-002-D20160414T084619

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk
# Create a new user (make sure they do not have Service Desk Application Access)
# Add the new user as a Customer in the specific Service Desk
# Make sure the user is part of a group that has the Browse Users Global Permission

h3. Expected Results

The User Picker should allow searching of users

!normalpicker.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results

The user picker does not allow searching of users in the Service Desk
 
!brokenpicker.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

Adding the user to the Service Desk Administrators or Service Desk Team group does not change this behavior
Giving the user Service Desk Application Access appears to resolve this behavior

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround outside of giving the user Service Desk Application Access. This does take up a Service Desk license however.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the [Approvals|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-jira-service-desk-approvals-815569154.html] feature in SD, a user will not be notified for an operation if:
# The ticket is in the status configured to 'Add approval',
# The user is an approver
Even if the user is an agent, an assignee or watcher.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk project
# Edit the Workflow to add a 'Waiting Approval' status with the 'App Approval' selected
#* In test, we removed the transitions from 'Waiting for customer' and 'Waiting for support' to 'Resolved', added one from them to 'Waiting Approval' and from 'Waiting Approval' to 'Resolved'
# Create a user with an email you can check
# Create a ticket
# Add the user as assignee and watcher, to make sure this user is notified for comments in this ticket
# Add user as approver
# In a status different from 'Waiting Approval', comment internally the ticket (notification 1)
# In status 'Waiting Approval', comment internally the ticket (notification 2)
# Remove user from 'approver'
# In a status different from 'Waiting Approval', comment internally the ticket (notification 3)
# In status 'Waiting Approval', comment internally the ticket (notification 4)

h3. Expected Results
User should receive all 4 notification messages for comments.

h3. Actual Results
User receives notification messages 1, 3 and 4, but not notification 2, as it's in the 'Waiting approval status' AND the user is an approver.

h3. Notes
Service Desk notifications are generally not sent, as well as 'internal comments', handled by JIRA. However, there were a few cases where we saw these working.

h3.Workaround
None so far.
fields.summary: Approvers are not notified of operations in 'Waiting for Approval' status

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Re-inviting users in Service Desk is not causing an email to be resent or giving any warnings. That is causing confusion, as users are using a tool that should generate an email, but doesn't.

Also, there's nothing in the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/managing-customers-686862678.html] saying what should happen when customers are invited again.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the 'Customers' page in a Service Desk
# Invite a customer, by clicking 'Invite', enter an email and click 'Send invites'
#* The invite will be sent
# Do the same process again _with the same email address_

h3. Expected Results
Either a new invite email is send (if this process was done twice, is most likely because the first one didn't work) or warn the user that a customer with that email already exists and no email will be sent.

h3. Actual Results
No email is sent and the invitation is silently ignored.
 
h3.Workaround
# Delete the created user in User Management
# Invite it again
fields.summary: Re-inviting user is not re-sending invitation email

fields.description:
Hosted JIRA Service Desk version 3.1.2

Seraph authenticator docs for *logout.url* settings states the following:

{quote}
<!-- URL for logging out.
                 - If relative, Seraph just redirects to this URL, which is responsible for calling Authenticator.logout().
                 - If absolute (eg. SSO applications), Seraph calls Authenticator.logout() and redirects to the URL
                 -->
            <param-name>logout.url</param-name>
            <param-value>/secure/logout!default.jspa</param-value>
{quote}

It works for relative urls. But for absolute urls, it just redirects to the given url without actually logging out the user. Upon inspecting the logout link on Service Desk customer portal I saw that it is simply an anchor tag with href to the link given to *logout.url* key in *seraph-config.xml*. No ajax call goes to JIRA. Thus user is never logged out but redirected.

This is a security issue since a user can leave an active session unattended.
fields.summary: Service Desk customer portal does NOT respect logout.url semantics of Seraph Authenticator

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA Service Desk user templates incorrectly display unencoded html entities when adding comments. For example if a user name has an apostraphe in it, such as "JIRA's Administrator", it will correctly display the ' character. This occurs with several other characters and they all display not-encoded, as it should:
 * ü (u-umlat)
 * - (hyphen)
 * * (asterisk)
 * _ (underscore)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an user with an apostrophe on the name (e.g. *JIRA's Administrator*)
 # Try to add a comment on the issue and see the encoded character on the comment field.
h3. Expected Results

The text displays as normal.
h3. Actual Results

The text does not display as expected.
h3. Notes

This occurs on transitions as in -JSD-3394-, which appears to be the same cause.

h3. Workaround

This can be worked around by disabling the templates as detailed in JSD-2257.
fields.summary: JSD shows characters as plain unencoded html entities

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When importing a backup of a Cloud instance which previously had Service Desk enabled, the import fails with the message that the Service Desk version is to old.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a JIRA Cloud instance enable JIRA Service Desk.
# create a Service Desk project with issues
# disable JIRA Service Desk.
# wait 6 months or when a new version of JIRA Service Desk is out.
# trigger a JIRA Cloud backup.
# import the JIRA Cloud backup into another JIRA Cloud instance.

h3. Expected Results
Import data successfully.

h3. Actual Results
An error message is triggered

{panel}
We can't complete your upgrade. It looks like the data you are trying to import is from an earlier version of JIRA Service Desk. You need to upgrade to JIRA Service Desk 3.0 first, then export new data and try again. Read these upgrade notes for instructions: http://confluence.atlassian.com/migration/jira-7/server_jira+jsd_upgrade
{panel}

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Importing a JIRA Cloud backup to another JIRA Cloud instance triggers a Service Desk version error

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Customers that don't have access to a request because of Issue Security still receive notifications from Service Desk about it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up Issue Security in a Service Desk project and configure a security level that would exclude at least one user. 
# Create a Service Desk request with said security level.
# Add a Request Participant that wouldn't be able to access the issue.

h3. Expected Results
One of the either:
- Notifications aren't sent to the new Request Participant as they wouldn't be able to access it.
- It's not possible to add a Request Participant who couldn't access the request.

h3. Actual Results
A Service Desk notification is sent to the new Participant, displaying all the details of the Customer Request. Clicking the link to the issue directs the user to a page stating:
{quote}You do not have permission to view this request.{quote}
fields.summary: Service Desk Notifications Sent to Users Who Cannot Access a Request

fields.description:
On /servicedesk/agent/DESK/people/agents this 3 scenarios could happen:
* User with Capital letters appears to have no issues assigned. [JSD-838|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-838]
* Renamed username appears to have no issues assigned.
* Renamed users to a previous username have their issues summed to someone else.

*Workaround:*
* For users with Capital Letters on the username, change the username to lowercase. See [JSD-838|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-838]
* For renamed users, change the username back to the previous username.
fields.summary: Agent's "Issues in progress" queue doesn't show the correct issues

fields.description:
As per this [document|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Configuring+public+signup] 
{quote}
When customers send emails to your email channel from email addresses that do not exist as user accounts in the system, their email addresses are automatically added as new users when public signup is enabled.If the service desk does not allow public signup, emails sent from new email addresses are not processed. 
{quote}

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
# Enable Public Signup in the JIRA Service Desk Project
# Create a new request from an existing customer 
# Issue is created, issue creation notification is sent to the customer 
# Customer replied to the notification, using an email alias 
# Comment will not be added: Email Setting logs will show *Unable to get user* 

!emailsettings.png|thumbnail!

h3. *Expected Behaviour*
* Responding to a notification using an email alias, should automatically create a new user when public signup is enabled

h3. *Actual Behaviour*
* Responding to a notification using an email alias, will not add comment to the issue and will show *Unable to get user* error in Email Settings logs.
fields.summary: Getting error "Unable to get user" with Public Signup enabled

fields.description:

2. Check the SLA tab: the translated name of "Time to resolution" metric has not been stored correctly, i.e. instead of "Время до решения" there is "????? ?? ???????".
3. Check the Settings tab:
a. Translated request names are not stored correctly (already reported in JSD-1419)
b. Russian names of request type groups are not stored correctly.
c. Status name to show to customer is not stored correctly (already reported in JSD-1427).
d. Customer Portal name doesn't store Russian characters correctly.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you have over 40 + queues. The queues are not accessible via the UI. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 40+ queues in the same Service Desk Project. 
# Attempt to scroll down to access queues that are "off screen". 

h3. Expected Results
You would be able to scroll down and see the queues. 
h3. Actual Results
Queues appear off screen. They are only accessible if you delete queues until they appear on screen again. 
 
h3.Workaround
For server there is a free add-on [Service Desk Queue Collapse|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/at.celix.jira.plugins.servicedesk-queue-collapse/server/overview]
fields.summary: Not able able to access queues after creating 40+ queues in the same project.

fields.description:
Our JSD is configured for an all German interface.
The new Satisfaction feature however ignores this and shows our customers an English "got it" page.

Also: This feature is not useful as long as there is no way of configuring the "got it" page!
fields.summary: Satisfaction feature does not support German user interface

fields.description:
It's possible to set up an automation rule that will attempt to execute a non-existent transition.

h6.Steps to reproduce
# go to *Settings > Automation* and edit or add an automation rule;
# in the 'IF' box, select a condition for an issue status;
# in the 'THEN' box, add a 'Transition issue' action and open the *Issue transition* dropdown.

*Expected result:* only transitions beginning in the status selected in step 2 in relevant workflow are available for automation.
*Actual result:* it's possible to select an unrelated transition for automation. When the 'IF' conditions are fulfilled, the transition would fail silently.
fields.summary: Automation rules don't verify the available transitions against the actual workflow

fields.description:
h3. How to reproduce:
- Go to Automation in project settings of a JSD project
- Create a new rule
- Set WHEN = Comment added
- Set IF = Comment contains
- Click Confirm, see the error message

 !Screen Shot 2016-08-10 at 3.02.13 PM.png|width=500px! 

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: In automation, 'Comment contains' IF condition fails to load when create/edit automation rules

fields.description:
h2.Summary
Existing SLA in Service Desk cannot be modified/edited. Adjustments can be made but changes cannot be saved.

h2.Steps to Replicate
# Go to an existing SLA configuration in a Service Desk project.
# Try to modify and save the changes.

h2.Expected Results
New SLA configurations can be changed and saved.

h2.Current Results
New SLA configurations cannot be saved.

h2. Notes
After saving, the new SLA seems like does save the changes but upon refreshing the page, the configurations turn back to original.

h2.Workaround
Instead of modifying an existing SLA, create a new SLA until this problem is fixed. The new SLA will not be applied to all tickets however so this workaround might not suitable if user plans to replace a old SLA with a newly created SLA (with the intended changes).
fields.summary: SLA cannot be modified/edited

fields.description:
When attempting to link a Confluence space as a knowledge base there are two issues:

# Only 50 results can be returned as described in [Confluence REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/static/rest/confluence/5.0.3.html#d2e321], specifically '@link DefaultRestSpaceManager#DEFAULT_MAX_SIZE' which is set at 50.
# A typed query for a space will result in a spinner and no results returned.

The typed query does perform a successful request, however these results are not rendered:

*Example:* 
Available Spaces:
{noformat}confluence=# select spacename from spaces;
      spacename
---------------------
 PDF Export
 Demonstration Space
 COMPY
 Epic Check
 Customiser
 Inherit
 Trial
(7 rows){noformat}

Request URL:
{noformat}Request URL:https://<ondemand-url>/rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/SER/kb/232badc9-aa3b-36cf-9dc0-50eb4eef759d/space?query=Epic&_=1409546835409{noformat} 

Response:
{noformat}{"queryTokens":["epic"],"query":"Epic","contentNameMatches":[[{"id":"1245187","name":"Epic Check","href":"/wiki/display/EC","className":"content-type-spacedesc","spaceName":"Epic Check","spaceKey":"EC"}],[{"name":"Search for ‘Epic’","href":"/wiki/dosearchsite.action?queryString=Epic","className":"search-for"}]]}{noformat}

Effect in JIRA ServiceDesk UI:
!confluence_kb_link.jpg|thumbnail!

*Workaround 1:* Using temporary user profile
* Create a temporary profile with access to administer the JIRA ServiceDesk as an individual here and
* Permission the temporary profile as an individual to see the desired space in Confluence. _This will restrict the items displayed in the drop-down_

*Workaround 2:* Database Edit
* Select and set a space from the 50 available results
* Confirm the desired space key from Confluence, including Space Key, Space Name and Space URL
* Raise a request via support.atlassian.com to perform an update on the table "AO_54307E_CONFLUENCEKB" linking to the desired space key
fields.summary: Cannot return search results in 'Configure a Confluence knowledge base'

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*
1. Create an issue type (through JIRA global settings)
2. Add it to an issue type scheme.
3. Create a project with the issue type scheme above.
4. Create a request type with the issue type.
5. Remove the issue type from the scheme for the project.
6. Delete the issue type (through JIRA global settings).
7. Go to the portal.

*Expected Behaviour*
Users would see an error when deleting the issue type or the request type would be removed/hidden.
An error would be displayed when viewing the request types under project settings.

*Actual Behaviour*
'Undefined' request types will appear beneath the other request types.
No request types are loaded in the project settings page due to an error caused by the missing issue type.

*Workaround*
For customer: currently no workaround.
For support with access to DB: deleting the incorrect requestTypes and GroupToRequestype rows from the database
fields.summary: "Undefined" Request Types in Service Desk Portal and Request Types table not loading under project settings when the issue type associated with a request type is deleted.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Replies via email from a Service Desk Reporter are always created as internal comments when the Service Desk project is using JIRA notification schemes.

h3. Environment
* 3.2.0-OD-12

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Service Desk Configuration
# Turn off the Service Desk notifications
# Go to JIRA notification schemes of the Service Desk project
# Add Reporter to the *Issue Commented* notification
# Login as the Reporter and raise a ticket in customer portal
# Login as the agent and put a comment on the ticket to notify the Reporter
# Reporter will receive a notification email and reply to it to put a comment
# The comment will be added as an internal comment instead of a public

h3. Expected Results
The comment should be added as a public comment.

h3. Actual Results
Comment will be added as an internal comment.
 
h3.Workaround
Use Service Desk notification.
fields.summary: Email replies by reporters are registered as internal comments when using JIRA notification schemes
Email requests setting doesn't accept hyphen(dash) '-' in email address for Cloud

fields.description:
Steps:
# Configure a KB for a Service Desk.
# View an issue in the Queues.
# Click on 'Create KB Article'

Expected result:
Inline dialog opens and user is able to create a article

Actual result:
It does not open.
fields.summary: Create KB button no longer works

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It's currently possible to set reporter as Request Participant via REST API.

h3. Environment
* CLOUD 3.3.0-OD-1000.564.0
* REST API 1000.445.0
* REST API latest - https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-servicedesk/REST/cloud/#servicedeskapi

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Run the following call on your instance ( (!) set the reporter as one of the request participants)
{code}https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/servicedeskapi/request
{
    "serviceDeskId": "2",
    "requestTypeId": "16",
    "requestFieldValues": {
        "summary": "Request JSD help via REST 2",
        "description": "I need a new mouse for my Mac"
    },
    "requestParticipants": [
        "user1",
      	"MyReporter"
    ]
}{code}

h3. Expected Results

The ticket should not get created because it's not possible to set a reporter as request participant. A similar message should return:
{code}{"errorMessage":"Sorry, but the following usernames could not be added as participant to this request: MyReporter","i18nErrorMessage":{"i18nKey":"sd.request.participants.username.error","parameters":["MyReporter"]}}{code}

h3. Actual Results
The ticket is created successfully and the reporter is set into the request participant list.

h3. Notes:
Via UI it's not possible to add reporter into the request participant's list.

h3.Workaround
None so far.
fields.summary: Create request via REST API is allowing to set reporter as Request Participant

fields.description:
h2. Summary
The date picker custom fields removes SLA data from ticket. 

h2.Steps to Replicate
# Create a new date picker custom field and add it to the *edit* screen of a JIRA Service Desk project.
# Create a ticket under the same project without filling in the date picker. SLA is there
# *Edit* the issue and fill in value to the date picker custom field and save the changes. SLA column gone.

h2.Expected Results
Date is set on the custom field and SLA is intact.

h2.Current Results
Date is set on the custom field and SLA is gone. Attempt to retrieve the SLA information from database returns null.
fields.summary: Date picker custom fields remove Service Desk SLA data in a ticket

fields.description:
When adding the role 'Service Desk Customer - Portal Access' to 'Create issues', 'Edit issues' and many other permissions, the following error message is displayed:
!Add_New_Permission_-_JIRA.jpeg!

In some cases, the error may appear after removing the Role from a Service Desk specific permission scheme such as: "JIRA Service Desk Permission Scheme for Project XX" making it impossible to restore it back.

Note: The error message correctly appears when trying to apply the Role 'Service Desk Customer - Portal Access'  to an admin permission like 'Administer Projects'.
fields.summary: Selected Permission 'Create Issues' is not valid for 'Service Desk Customer - Portal Access'

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When linking an external Confluence with SD project in order to serve the KB, search for KB doesn't show the list of related KB if the customer is searching from customer portal.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an application link between an external Confluence
# Create a SD project
# Go to *Project Setting* > *Knowledge base*
# Link to a Confluence space
# Select Application: External Confluence
# Space: Any space
# Link
# Go to customer portal https://example.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/1
# Search KB on the search box

h3. Expected Results
List of related KB should be shown

h3. Actual Results
List of related KB doesn't show. 
!Screenshot1.jpeg!
However, a list of KB is shown on Global Portal. (Screenshot2)
!Screenshot2.jpeg!

h3. Notes
This only happens if the KB is linked to Confluence from a different instance. If Confluence of the same instance is used, KBs will be shown on customer portal.
!Screenshot3.jpeg!

The developer console returns a 501 from {{/rest/servicedesk/knowledgebase/latest/articles/search?project=<project>&spaceKey=<space>&query=<query>}}

h3.Workaround
Search the KB in Global Portal.
fields.summary: Knowledge base article search doesn't work on customer portal when external Confluence is used

fields.description:

When an e-mail is sent in to the JSD mail handler that contains a character not parsable by the HtmlToWikiTextConverter, an exception is thrown and error is visible in the mail processing logs.

*  JIRA Service Desk v3.2.0-OD-03

https://<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/SDMailInfo.jspa
- Click *View log* to the right of the e-mail address used for your Service Desk, then click the *Processing Log* tab. The error {{String index out of range: 0}} will be in the *Details* column.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the SD project queue, users are able to sort queue but not able to save them after sorting. Refreshing page returns the new order.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Drag queues to sort the order
# Refresh page

h3. Expected Results
Queue order changes immediately 

h3. Actual Results
# Queue order return to default
# Refresh to see the new order

h3. Notes
This bug has evolved into being able to change but only refresh to see the effect.

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Not possible to save queue sort order

fields.description:
*What's happening*
The workaround suggested to search for Customer Request types stopped working.
In earlier versions of JIRA Service Desk (2.4-OD-04) users could use the following syntax when searching for Customer Request Types using JQL:
{code}
"Customer Request Type" = "<projectKey>/<request-type>"
{code}
I worked just fine and sometimes all the user needed to do was to look directly in the database the correct values for the <request-typ> when the usual values didn't match.
However, since 2.5.1-OD-03-002, it stopped working.

*Expected behaviour*
Searching for *Customer Request Type* should be possible using the correct syntax:
{code}
"Customer Request Type" = "<projectKey>/<request-type>"
{code}

*Actual Behaviour*
It's not possible anymore to search request types even if the values for the <request-type> constraint match the database key values.
fields.summary: The workaround suggested when searching for Customer Request Type stopped to work.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Create custom email channel
# Go to request type
# See that there is EMAIL icon next to selected request type
# Refresh page
Expected result: EMAIL icon is still in place
Actual result: EMAIL icon is disappeared
Also, if I tried to delete the request type, server hangs

 !E2dit_Request_Type_Group_-_Service_Desk.jpg|thumbnail!  

 !E1dit_Request_Type_Group_-_Service_Desk.jpg|thumbnail!  

 !Edit_Request_Type_Group_-_Service_Desk.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Email icon for custom email on a request type dissapeared

fields.description:
Through the Automation plugin of JIRA Agile it's possible to create a rule to Alert users when a given condition is met.
This rule can be executed either by the user who triggered the rule, or by the project default user.
If the rule is set to "Run as the user who triggered the rule" and the one who triggered the rule is a customer of this Service Desk, then an internal comment will be created by the rule in the customer's name mentioning the listed users in the rule.

*Steps to reproduce*
* Create a Service Desk;
* Set a new automation rule of type "Alert user" to happen when creating the issue, for example;
* In the rule "Options" select "Run as the user who triggered the rule";
* Make a customer (portal-only) raise a request in this service desk.

*Expected*
Users are mentioned in the issue and emails are sent to notify them.

*Actual*
An internal comment is made and the users mentioned never receive any emails.
fields.summary: Automation rules of type Alert user fails to notify the mentioned users.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Due to the recent release at {{21st September 2015}}, SD customers don't get mail notification
Apart from the issue, users also will notice that the {{My Requests}} showing incorrect numbers of tickets/requests

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have 2 users as _Assignee_ and _Reporter_ & 1 Customer in Request Participant
# Add a comment in one of the issues in SD project

For {{My Requests}}, it will show less results than expected. Some all requests is not showing up

h3. Expected Results
Mail notifications should be sent out to Assignee, Reporter and Request Participant
My Requests populate the actual numbers of tickets

h3. Actual Results
Only Assignee receives the notification
My Requests shows inaccurate count of tickets

h3. Workaround
For notification issue: Disable and enable JIRA Service Desk
For observation on My Requests, there is no workaround thus far. A fix is currently being worked on and will update further in this issue

Please log a support request at https://support.atlassian.com if you need assistance from the support team
(i) Only affects the JIRA Service Desk Cloud as of now
fields.summary: SD customers don't get mail notification and My Requests does not show history tickets

fields.description:
Summary
When a request type group is deleted, the request types within that group should be hidden when searching in the portal. These are hidden from searching in the project's portal as expected, but not when searching in the shared customer portal.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Service Desk project
 # Delete the 'General' request type group, which should hide all of the request types in that group in the Customer Portal
 # Navigate to the Customer Portal for that project
 # Search for 'emp', notice that no results are found matching this request type and project
 # Navigate to the shared portal Help Center
 # Search for 'emp', notice that request types within the deleted group from the project are appearing, e.g. "Employee exit"

h3. Expected Results

Request types from the group that was deleted should not appear in the shared portal Help Center search.
h3. Actual Results

Request types that should be hidden are appearing in the search results.
fields.summary: Request types hidden by deleting parent group appear in shared portal search

fields.description:
Scenario
 * Configure a request type with an optional due date field
 * Remove Schedule Issues project permission from a user/group
 * Access the portal as that user/group for the request type. The due date field is hidden from the customer because they do not have schedule issues permission.
 * Try to create a request. The submission will fail and show an error even though the due date field is optional. 

Expected behaviour
 * The customer should be able to create requests without the schedule issues permission if the due date field is optional
fields.summary: Creating requests without schedule issues permission fails even if due date field is optional

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When selecting the {{Back to JIRA}} button in the User Management page, the user will see a continual loop in the browser when trying to navigate back to a JIRA Service Desk project. 

h3. Environment
* Cloud instance with JIRA Service Desk

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to a JIRA Service Desk Project
# Select !https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/444107050/cog.png!>> *User Management*
# Once on the User Management page (<Cloud UR>/admin/users), click the {{Back to JIRA}} button.

h3. Expected Results
You are taken back to the project page you were previously on. 
h3. Actual Results
You are taken back to the project, but it fails to load. You will see a continuous loop as the page tries to load. 

h3.Workaround
The only workaround is to return to your home URL and then select the project from the {{Projects}} dropdown.
fields.summary: Cannot go back to JSD project from User Management page

fields.description:
In OnDemand, using a date picker in a customer portal request form doesn't work, leaving an error message in the browser console:

"Uncaught RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded" in Chrome or "too much recursion" in Firefox.

This is due to a change in the underlying JIRA code in OnDemand, and does not affect Service Desk installations from Atlassian Marketplace. Service Desk 1.2.4 contains a fix to stop the console error and will be released to OnDemand shortly, but the date picker does nothing.

We will update this issue when we have details about the fix in JIRA being deployed to OnDemand.
fields.summary: Customer portal request forms: Date picker doesn't work in OnDemand

fields.description:
When the Reporter and Assignee of a Service Desk request are the same JIRA user, a valid JIRA User with SD Agent permissions, JIRA will suppress any Internal Comment notifications for this user, except for the first.
"Share with customer" comment type seems to work just fine.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a SD project;
# Create a request or use an existent
# Change the Assignee and Reporter of the request to be the same user;
# Do an internal comment > the notification should be send just fine.
# Do another internal comment;

h3. Expected
Customer should receive the notification because he's also the Assignee of the issue.

h3. Actual
The user won't receive the notifications for the internal comments.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
According to our documentation [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/adding-request-participants-732528959.html#Addingrequestparticipants-Addrequestparticipantsviaemail]:
bq. If you create or respond to a request via email, add a request participant's email address to the TO and CC fields. *The participant must have a JIRA Service Desk account to be added to the request.* 

However, the last sentence is incorrect(outdated) since January 2016. Please refer to the comment [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-1699?focusedCommentId=855080&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-855080]:

{quote}
The solution that has been implemented here, is as discussed above:
* For a public signup enabled service desk
* When processing the email for create / comment, it will check all TO / CC addresses and if they do not exist, new customers will be created and invited to the service desk, and added to the issue as Request Participants.
* In addition to this functionality through email, in the customer portal request details, if allowed by permissions, customers can also invite new users by entering their email address
* both of these are only with public signup, and the request security is configured to allow customers to manage participants
{quote}
fields.summary: Outdated Information on Request Participants page.

fields.description:
The field help in the service desk portal is broken; it appears that the help field text gets moved under the actual fields if the number of characters in the field help exceeds a certain amount (about 38 characters).   The formatting was fine up until sometime between last week and today.   See attachment for the issue I am seeing (see correctly formatted vs formatting problem).  The only change I made to the help field is adding the extra '12345' characters, which pushes the help field text under the field it is intended to explain.  Previously all help field text stayed on the right side of their respective field, regardless of wiki markup and length.  Now beyond 38 characters causes this issue. 

This is a serious issue regarding the portal as our clients are using this daily.  Perhaps the html for the portal was updated and messed things up.
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk - Field Help formatting is broken

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After creating a cascade custom field, required in an SD project, and enabling Email Requests, JIRA keeps showing an error saying it doesn't have a default value, even if it has.

h3. Environment

Affected version: 3.3.0-OD-1000.82.0 (couldn't find in the field)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Select List (Cascade) custom field and add options to it
# Create an SD project
# Make the field required in the project (via Field Configuration)
# Edit a Request Type and hide the cascade field, setting a default value.
# Enable Email Requests
#* It will work, so JIRA can tell the field has a default value, otherwise, it'd not allow Email Requests with a required field without value
# Navigate once or twice within the project
# Disable Email Requests

h3. Expected Results
No errors are shown in the project

h3. Actual Results
From step 6 on, even after disabling Email Requests, the project keeps showing this error (in pop-up window):
{noformat}
This service desk project has configuration problems and may not work as expected.
View error details and repair the problem
{noformat}

When we click {{View error details and repair the problem}} (in new pop-up window):
{code}
The Get IT help request form contains configuration errors
The following hidden fields on the request type do not have the required preset values:
	•	My Cascade Field
To repair this request type, set a value for these fields at the fields page.
{code}

h3. Notes
We also tested with a default 'Select' field, which did not cause the error.

* Confirmed that the field does not have to be required in the field configuration for this to occur. I believe the two requirements for this to occur are for it to be a cascading field, and for email requests to be turned on.

h3.Workaround
None so far.
fields.summary: Required cascade field is causing error to appear in JIRA SD project

We can confirm that Service Desk is able to find the user because if we set ‘Customers can search for other customers when adding participants’ option to ON, it is possible to find users even if we enter their name/email using the wrong case.

!addpeople_search_on.png!
!addpeople_search_off.png!

_Noticed on Cloud instances - JIRA Service Desk v2.3-OD-08-002-D20150218T054701_

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to invite a Customer to a Service Desk that is currently either an inactive user, or the user was removed from the instance and still is associated with a JIRA issue(reporter, assignee, or comment added).

This is due to the user having already existed in JIRA and has association with a JIRA Issue, therefore JIRA is maintaining a copy of the user in its database.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.1.0-OD-05-006
* JIRA Service Desk 3.1.0-OD-12-001

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a user to JIRA
# Create a JIRA Issue as the user, assign issue to user, or add comment as user
# Delete the user from JIRA, or mark the user as inactive (both trigger the same results)
# Try to invite the user to Service Desk Project as Customer

h3. Expected Results
An error should be displayed with more accurate verbage regarding the issue, and provided documentation/direction on how to fix.

h3. Actual Results
Receive vague/unhelpful error {color:red}*Could not invite some customers, user not found.*{color}

h3.Workaround if user has been removed entirely
# Visit User Management on the instance (https://<instance>.atlassian.net/admin/users)
# Click Create User and re-create the user with the email address that failed the Service Desk customer invite.
-- When creating the user, ensure that no application access is selected
# After the User has been added, select *Restricted Portal* access
# Proceed to the Service Desk and re-invite the Customer

h3. Workaround if user has been deactivated
# Check the inactive users in User Management (https://<instance>.atlassian.net/admin/users?activeFilter=inactive)
# Navigate to the user's User Management profile
# Remove from any unwanted Groups/Applications
# Re-activate user
# Invite to Service Desk
fields.summary: As an admin, Could Not Invite Some Customers, User Not Found when inviting a user

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a Service Desk Project's Email Requests are enabled, and the Issue Type linked to the Request Type is removed from the project's Issue Type Scheme, an error will be thrown upon visiting the Email Requests page and attempting to Turn on email requests. This error will only be thrown if there is another Request Type availabe that is suitable for Email Requests.

h3. Environment
* JSD v3.3.0-OD-1000.36.0
* JIRA v1000.184.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk Project
# Navigate to the Issue Types page within the project's Administration
# Remove the Issue Type associated with the Email Requests Request Type
# Navigate to the Email Requests page, click "Turn on email requests"
# Observe error

h3. Expected Results
Service Desk should gracefully choose the next available Request Type suitable for e-mail, or if none, provide an alert to create one.

h3. Actual Results
The below error is thrown in a modal window:
{noformat}
Error when turning on email
This email address is not used by this service desk any more.
{noformat}

And a 400 error is returned from {{/rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/<project key>/incomingemail/turnOnForOnDemand}}:

{code}
{
    "errors": [{
        "errorMessage": "This email address is not used by this service desk any more."
    }
    ],
    "reasonKey": "com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.emailchannel.EmailChannelNotFound$",
    "reasonCode": "400"
}
{code}

h3. Notes
- This error doesn't occur when Email Requests are turned off prior to removing the issue type
- This error doesn't occur if there is no other request type suitable for Email Requests

h3.Workaround
# Add the previously removed Issue Type back into the Service Desk Project's Issue Type Scheme
# On the Email Requests page, choose a different Request Type associated with a different Issue Type that is intended to be kept for the project
# Remove the Issue Type again if no longer needed.

- Alternatively, Turn off Email Requests prior to removing any Issue Types from the project.
fields.summary: Error when attempting to turn on Email Request if Email Request's Issue Type is Removed from Project Issue Type Scheme

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In JIRA Service Desk, IE11 will only render a custom logo on a customer portal if the image is in a .PNG format. .BMP, .JPG, .GIF logos will break in IE11(see screenshots). Chrome, Firefox and Safari will render the any of the mentioned image formats without issue.
  
||IE11||Chrome||
|!Screen Shot 2017-03-10 at 4.47.25 PM.png|width=182,height=128!|!Screen Shot 2017-03-10 at 4.47.12 PM.png|thumbnail!|
h3. Environment

JIRA Service Desk 3.3.0-OD-1000.1015.2

JIRA 1000.815.2
h3. Steps to Reproduce

_On JIRA Service Desk:_
 # Navigate to: [NameOfYourProject] > Project Settings > Portal Settings: Logo
 # Click "Choose logo" and select a .BMP, .JPG or .GIF image
 # Save the selection
 # Access the customer portal in IE11

h3. Expected Results

Logo image is rendered in IE11
h3. Actual Results

Image is not rendered in IE11 (see screenshot in Summary)
h3. Notes
 * Renaming an image to .PNG will not work - the image needs to be converted to a .PNG
 * Firefox , Chrome, Safari will render all the mentioned image formats
 * Testing was conducted on the following browsers:
 ** Firefox 51.0.1 (64-bit)
 ** Safari 10.0.3
 ** Chrome 56.0.2924.87 (64-bit)
 ** IE11 11.0.9600.18097

h3. Workaround

Convert your logo to a .PNG image and upload to your customer portal.
fields.summary: Customer portal logo broken on IE11

fields.description:
Steps to repro:
 # Go to [https://example.atlassian.net/servicedesk/admin/IT/confluence-kb|https://example.atlassian.net/servicedesk/admin/IT/confluence-kb]
 # Disable KB integration
 # Enable KB Integration
 # Select the _IT_ space

Expected: Working KB link that looks like [https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/IT|https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/IT]

Actual: Broken KB link that looks like [https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/wiki/spaces/IT|https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/wiki/spaces/IT]

Impact: JSD is not mitigating ticket creation.

 

We were able to reproduce the error in different instances (both prod and dev, at different versions). It's intermittent and might happens or not in new projects.
fields.summary: Link to KB in JSD has /wiki twice in path resulting in broken KB functionality

fields.description:
*Summary*

When an issue goes into an approval status and we need to transition it out of this status without using the 'Approve' or 'Decline' function buttons in the customer portal, the Approvals values stay in place. Even when transitioning the issue to the previous status, users can still Approve or Decline the issue and the approvals process does not restart once going into the approval status again.

*Steps to Reproduce*
 - Create an workflow with approval and create a transition to back from the approval status to the previous status. Publish the workflow.
 - Create an issue and transition to the approval status. Transition it back to the preveous status. The 'Approve' and 'Decline' buttons will keep available in the customer portal.

*Expected Results*

Approvals values resets when an issue leaves an approval status.

*Actual Results*

Approvals values do not reset when an issue leaves an approval status.

*Workaround*

Create a post function to clear the _Approvers_ field value when leaving the approval status and manually add the approvars again in JIRA Service Desk.

_Please note while this workaround will clear the list of Approvers for the issue, however this will not reset the Approvals count as this is generated programtically and not a stored value which can be cleared._
fields.summary: Not able to clear approval values
Run automation rules as... cannot be edited

fields.description:
When ticket is shared with Organization each person from Org received an email. There is an option in my email notification "Turn off this request's notifications", so I assumed that if I do not click on it, I will continue received the notifications which is not true as by default no one from organizations is subscribed to the ticket (only get an initial create notification)
  !Search_results_-_aromanenko_atlassian_com_-_Atlassian_Mail.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Misleading option "Turn off this request's notifications" in the email when you are not subscribed

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Table is not removed in the description if the issue is created from email contains tables.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Have a Service Desk project and enable Email Request
# Send an email that contains table in it.

h3. Current Result

Table is not removed in the description.

h3. Expected Result

Table is removed from the description.
fields.summary: Table is not removed in the description if the issue is created from email

fields.description:
The cause is that all notification emails are generated with the same data and soy template and the only thing that make the emails different is *when* the event was fired. So if a server is slow and two different events get fired, but don't get processed until after the second event is fired, then they will send the same email.

*Bug Fix*
Fix would involve a change to how the email templates are generated and may involve updating the email templates with a new design
fields.summary: Duplicate notifications sometimes sent out on slower servers
